result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Dean Stand Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Dean Stand Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Dean Stand Jr. was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Court waives all costs and the DNA surcharge.
Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.

Concurrent with any other sentence Defendant is currently serving.
Court grants Huber for work/seek work.
Concurrent with:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Dean Stand Jr.

of Counsel filed by Atty Alex Andrea. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael Dean Stand appeared.  Court called.  Set for PTC.  Includes case 15CM645 & 16CM79.  There is an agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 from a Resisting or obstructing an officer to Obstructing and Officer  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 16CM79.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 Obstructing an Officer in 16CM79. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM79 & 15CM645. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

DE ordered to serve 40 days in the SCC Jail to run concurrent with any other sentences being currently served
- Court waives all costs and the DNA surcharge
- Court grants huber for work/seek work
- DE to provide the DRC with a DNA sample
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on October 22, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael Dean Stand appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 15CM645 & 16CM79.   State has made an offer.  DE needs time to review it.  DE has a plea date on September 18, 2018 in Sawyer County.  Court continues the PTC.  Bails are continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Andrea. km
Per EJL 7/6/18 - Faxed Dispatch, Jail and Sheriff. eif
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2018 at 11:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Amanda Stand.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: EJL, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Francis D. Collins,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Michael Dean Stand appeared from jail.  Includes 16CM79 (Init) and 15CM645 (RW). QUASH WARRANT. Court confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on 16CM79. Defendant had moved to SD for work.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 27, 2018 at 11:00 am.
